title: Getting Started with Django REST Framework (DRF) and AngularJS (Part 2)
description:
Read: Part 1 - Initial Project Setup Write: Part 2 Supplementary Code

This is the second post in a multi-part series geared toward getting started with Django Rest Framework (DRF) and AngularJS. The goal of this series is to create an extensive, RESTful web application that uses DRF in the server and AngularJS in the client.

This post focuses on Django, with topics covering

  • A Description of Our Series Project
  • Adding a new Project Module
  • Defining Database Models
  • Migrating Database Models
  • Creating Model Data via the Django ORM

We will be using Django 1.8.5 and Djang

title: Launch Websites With Ionic Using The InAppBrowser
description:
With Ionic 2 development in full force, I figured it would be a good idea to update one of my more popular blog articles. Previously I had written about using the Apache Cordova InAppBrowser to launch external URLs using Ionic Framework 1. This time Iâ€™m going to accomplish the same, but using Ionic 2 and Angular.

Like with the previous tutorial we will be using the Apache Cordova InAppBrowser plugin. The only change is in our framework.

The post Launch Websites With Ionic Using The InAppBrowser appeared first on The Polyglot Developer.
